page.title: 05TOURISM IN HARDWICK
page.content: { Hardwick Hall}has dominated the area for nearly four hundred years. Along with the estate and parkland it is now managed by the{National Trust.}It comes as no surprise, therefore, that{tourism}is perhaps the area's greatest industry. The Hall itself lures over 55 thousand visitors each year and when one sees it towering magnificently over the miles of parkland the reason is immediately obvious. The{parkland}attached to the Hall plays host to hundreds of thousands of visitors each year. They come to{fish in the rivers,{canoe,}follow the {nature walks}or merely enjoy a family {picnic}and relax in the beautiful countryside.
